CIRCULAR NO.  20  /2001 
 
 
In order to prevent weapons explosives or any other dangerous devices which 
may be used to commit an act. Of unlawful interference, the carriage or bearing of which 
is not authorized, from being introduced by any means whatsoever, on board an aircraft 
engaged in civil aviation, it is advisable that hand baggage are not carried by passengers 
on board the flights organization from the civil airports in India.  However the passengers 
may carry with them the essential items required on board the flight like medicines, milk 
for babies only. 
 
If the above guidelines are willfully implemented by the passengers and their full 
corporation is extended to the security agencies responsible for implementing the  
security instructions, we are sure that we will in position to security our flights from 
perpetrators. 
 
 
The Contents of the above circular may be displayed by Airport Operator 
Concerned on  a notice board at the entry point of the Airports and also near the Check in 
counters. for information of all passengers, employees and security personnel. 
 
 
 
 
(Veeranna Aivalli) 
Commissioner of Security
